1.content: I woke up to the sound of an alarm blaring in my ear and light shining through my blinds "What time is it" I muttered groggily as I rolled over to hit stop on my alarm. As I stood and began stumbling to the bathroom to brush my teeth and get ready for the day it took me a moment to shake the fog of sleep from my mind but once I did I remembered why I subjected myself to the torture of waking up at 6 in the morning. After I brushed my teeth and took my shower I fixed my hair and looked in the mirror. I was greeted by my rather average   looking face. After getting my shoes on I pause to decide where I want to go, if only I knew the importance of my decision...

11.content: It didn't take long for me to find a yard sale, there were actually two only a couple houses apart, neither looked like they had any furniture, but I figured I might as well stop to see if there is anything at a good price I could grab. After parking and walking up to see what's there I saw a chest filled with a bunch of stuff, as I looked through it I found a folded piece of paper with some strange writing on it. I always liked history and ancient languages so I folded it up, slipped it into my pocket, and headed back to my car. The rest of the day went reasonably as I found a couple of pieces of decent furniture, and met a few cute neighbors, but all I could think about the entire day was that little slip of paper. When I got home I went straight to my room and sat down at my computer to try to see what the words meant. However, no matter how many different languages I researched, the words on that paper belonged to none of them. Frustrated, I looked down at the words and, as if a dam suddenly broke, the pronunciation of the words popped into my head. As I spoke them aloud, the paper suddenly caught on fire and I felt the urge to speak them.
11.title: Yard sale 1 (bodyswap)
